meanings.definition: To steal or take something quickly or slyly.
meanings.sent1: She was snaffling cookies from the jar when no one was looking.
meanings.sent2: The thief was caught snaffling jewelry from the store.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon was snaffling shiny objects from the campsite.
meanings.sent4: The pickpocket was skilled at snaffling wallets without being noticed.
meanings.sent5: The spy was snaffling secret documents under the cover of darkness.

meanings.definition: To eat or consume something quickly and greedily.
meanings.sent1: The kids were snaffling candy at the party.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't resist snaffling the last piece of cake.
meanings.sent3: The dog was snaffling treats from the table when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: She was snaffling popcorn during the movie, making a mess.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel was snaffling nuts from the bird feeder with great enthusiasm.
